description:
doc: delete go course notes
They're out of date, a pain to maintain, and most of the material
is better served by the Go Tour.

Fixes issue 2101.

messages.text:
LGTM

Rather than closing that issue, I would create a new issue (with the HelpWanted) to convert these slides to templated HTML so that we can keep them alive. They're a great walkthrough.

It's a great task for someone who has spare time and wants to help out.

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

On Dec 19, 2011, at 1:30 PM, r@golang.org wrote:

> *** Abandoned ***

submitted, actually.

I'll let others respond before submitting.

-rob

On Dec 15, 2011, at 3:29 PM, adg@golang.org wrote:

> LGTM
> 
> Rather than closing that issue, I would create a new issue (with the
> HelpWanted) to convert these slides to templated HTML so that we
> can keep them alive. They're a great walkthrough.
> 
> It's a great task for someone who has spare time and wants to help out.

Maybe. It's a large amount of work to maintain them, although not a prohibitive amount. I'm trying to avoid that work. Having someone else do the updates will require a probably equal or larger amount of review work. I don't see that as a win.

-rob

On 16 December 2011 10:33, Rob 'Commander' Pike <r@google.com> wrote:
>
> On Dec 15, 2011, at 3:29 PM, adg@golang.org wrote:
>
>> LGTM
>>
>> Rather than closing that issue, I would create a new issue (with the
>> HelpWanted) to convert these slides to templated HTML so that we
>> can keep them alive. They're a great walkthrough.
>>
>> It's a great task for someone who has spare time and wants to help out.
>
> Maybe. It's a large amount of work to maintain them, although not a prohibitive amount. I'm trying to avoid that work. Having someone else do the updates will require a probably equal or larger amount of review work. I don't see that as a win.

Hmm, yeah.

I'll take a look at the course notes, and create issues in the go-tour
project to cover the topics that are covered in the course but not the
tour.

Andrew

>> 
>> Maybe. It's a large amount of work to maintain them, although not a prohibitive amount. I'm trying to avoid that work. Having someone else do the updates will require a probably equal or larger amount of review work. I don't see that as a win.
> 
> Hmm, yeah.

> I'll take a look at the course notes, and create issues in the go-tour

perfect.
